intro: Thelythamnos filiformis, commonly known as the slender thistle, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features narrow, spiny leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Thelythamnos filiformis is adapted to survive in drought conditions, with deep roots and a low, sprawling growth habit. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
